NodeIteratorPreviousNode.summary:
The NodeIterator.previousNode() method returns the
previous node in the set represented by the and moves the
position of the iterator backwards within the set.

remarks.para:
This method returns null when the current node is the first node in the
set.

In old browsers, as specified in old versions of the specifications, the method may
throws the INVALID_STATE_ERR if this method
is called after the method. Recent browsers never
throw.

NodeIteratorPreviousNode.returns: A representing the node before the current node in the set represented by this NodeIterator, or null if the current node is the first node in the set.
